ai-sn39:1-15.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sāriputta was staying in the land of the Vajjis near Ukkacelā on the bank of the Ganges river.
ai-sn39:1-15.1.2_0: Then the wanderer Sāmaṇḍaka went up to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-sn39:1-15.1.2_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-sn39:1-15.1.3_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-sn39:1-15.1.3_1: The wanderer Sāmaṇḍakāni said to Sāriputta:
ai-sn39:1-15.2.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, they speak of this thing called ‘extinguishment’.
ai-sn39:1-15.2.3_0: “Reverend, the ending of greed, hate, and delusion
ai-sn39:1-15.2.5_0: “But, reverend, is there a path and a practice for realizing this extinguishment?”
ai-sn39:1-15.3.2_0: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
ai-sn39:1-15.3.4_0: This is the path, the practice, for realizing this extinguishment.”
ai-sn39:1-15.3.5_0: “Reverend, this is a fine path, a fine practice, for realizing this extinguishment.
ai-sn39:1-15.3.6_0: But it’s enough to be diligent.”
ai-sn39:1-15.4.1_0: (These should be expanded in the same way as the Linked Discourses with Jambukhādaka.)
ai-sn39:16.1.1_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, is there difficult to do in this teaching and training?”
ai-sn39:16.1.2_0: “Going forth, reverend, is hard to do in this teaching and training.”
ai-sn39:16.1.3_0: “But what’s hard to do for someone who has gone forth?”
ai-sn39:16.1.4_0: “When you’ve gone forth it’s hard to be satisfied.”
ai-sn39:16.1.5_0: “But what’s hard to do for someone who’s hard to do?”
ai-sn39:16.1.6_0: “When you’re satisfied, it’s hard to practice in line with the teaching.”
ai-sn39:16.1.7_0: “But if a mendicant practices in line with the teaching, will it take them long to become a perfected one?”
ai-sn39:16.1.11_0: The Linked Discourses with _paṇḍakas_ are complete.
